title: How to Make a Crafting Table in Minecraft

steps.title: Find a tree.
steps.content: Find a tree. To create a crafting table, you'll need four wooden planks, which can be crafted with one block of wood from a tree. Trees are in most areas of Minecraft, so just look around.

steps.title: Collect one block of wood.
steps.content: Collect one block of wood. Tap and hold a piece of the tree's trunk until it breaks, then walk over the block to pick it up. You don't need any tools to break wood, though using an axe will expedite the process.

steps.title: Open your inventory.
steps.content: Open your inventory. Tap â‹¯ in the lower-right corner of the screen. If you're following this method for Bedrock Edition on a non-mobile platform, use the key or button that you would usually use instead.

steps.title: Tap the "Construction" tab.
steps.content: Tap the "Construction" tab. This brick-shaped icon is in the upper-left corner of the window.

steps.title: Tap the "Wood Planks" option.
steps.content: Tap the "Wood Planks" option. It's in the main section of the "Construction" tab. This will add your wood block to the crafting section that's on the right side of the screen.

steps.title: Select the stack of wood planks.
steps.content: Select the stack of wood planks. Tap the stack of four wood planks below the crafting section to add them to your inventory.

steps.title: Tap the "Items" tab.
steps.content: Tap the "Items" tab. It's a bed-shaped icon on the left side of the window.

steps.title: Tap the "Crafting Table" option.
steps.content: Tap the "Crafting Table" option. You'll find this block in the main "Items" window.

steps.title: Select the crafting table.
steps.content: Select the crafting table. It's below the crafting section. Doing so will automatically add the crafting table to your inventory. If you want to place the crafting table, select it in your equip bar and then tap the ground on which you want to put it.

steps.title: Find a tree.
steps.content: Find a tree. To create a crafting table, you'll need four wooden planks, which can be crafted with one block of wood from a tree. Trees are in most areas of Minecraft, so just look around.

steps.title: Collect one block of wood.
steps.content: Collect one block of wood. Left-click and hold a block in the tree trunk until it breaks, then walk over the block to pick it up. You don't need any tools to break wood, though using an axe will expedite the process.

steps.title: Open your inventory.
steps.content: Open your inventory. Press E to do so. Your inventory window will pop up. If you change the key that you use to open the inventory, press that key instead.

steps.title: Select the block of wood.
steps.content: Select the block of wood. Click the block of wood in your inventory to add it to your mouse pointer, which will allow you to drag the block around your inventory.

steps.title: Click one of the crafting section squares.
steps.content: Click one of the crafting section squares. The crafting section is in the upper-right side of the inventory window. Clicking any one of the four squares in the crafting area will add your wood block to it, prompting a stack of four planks to appear below the crafting section.

steps.title: Select the wooden planks.
steps.content: Select the wooden planks. Click the stack of four wooden planks that appears below the crafting section.

steps.title: Add the wooden planks to the crafting section.
steps.content: Add the wooden planks to the crafting section. Right-click each of the four squares in the crafting grid. You should now have one plank in each section of the grid.

steps.title: Click the crafting table icon.
steps.content: Click the crafting table icon. It's below the crafting section.

steps.title: Move the crafting table to your inventory.
steps.content: Move the crafting table to your inventory. Click a space in your inventory or equip bar to do so. If you want to place the crafting table, click a space in your equip bar at the bottom of the inventory, then close the inventory, select the crafting table, and right-click a space in which you want to place it.

steps.title: Find a tree.
steps.content: Find a tree. To create a crafting table, you'll need four wooden planks, which can be crafted with one block of wood from a tree. Trees are in most areas of Minecraft, so just look around.

steps.title: Collect one block of wood.
steps.content: Collect one block of wood. Face the tree trunk that you want to break, hold down the right trigger until it breaks, and then walk over the block to pick it up. You don't need any tools to break wood, though using an axe will expedite the process.

steps.title: Open the crafting menu.
steps.content: Open the crafting menu. Press X (Xbox) or square (PlayStation) to do so.

steps.title: Select the "Structures" tab.
steps.content: Select the "Structures" tab. This is usually the tab that opens immediately; it has an image of a wood plank on its tab, which is at the top of the menu.

steps.title: Create wood planks.
steps.content: Create wood planks. Select the "Wood Plank" option, scroll down until you find your version of wood, then press A (Xbox) or X (PlayStation). For example, if you collected birch wood, you would scroll down until you found the Birch Wood Planks option.

steps.title: Select the crafting table.
steps.content: Select the crafting table. Scroll over until your cursor is selecting the crafting table icon.

steps.title: Create the crafting table.
steps.content: Create the crafting table. Press A or X to do so. The crafting table will automatically be added to your equip bar if there's room for it; if not, it will go to your inventory. You can place the crafting table on the ground by selecting it in your equip bar, facing a block on which you want to place the crafting table, and pressing the left trigger.
